title: multiplication of large big.Int throws out of memory
body:
by **dave@klaff.org**: 
In this program http://play.golang.org/p/SShKp1OI4L the third multiplication (line 24)
doesn't succeed even though it should generate a smaller big.Int value than the
multiplication on line 14.

What is the expected output?  big.Int of about 12,000,000 bits should not need > 1GB
of memory.

What do you see instead?  Out of memory 


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?  Whichever is used on Windows.

Which operating system are you using? Windows XP

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version') go1.0.2


Please provide any additional information below.
